display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: "Helvetica"; color: light-dark(#000000, #ffffff); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
div.font: We need to identify sentences that are semantically similar. This way, we can bring together sections of a document that refer to the same topic
Sentence embeddings allow us to semantically compare sentences using cosine similarity. this can be done for clustering purposes.

Additionally, we can generate embeddings that are ideal for retrieval. Their models have been pre-trained on the task of finding relevant sentences to a query. This can be used both in filtering important sentences, as well as in the initial retrieval stage

switch.text: We need to identify sentences that are semantically...

a.text: Text is not SVG - cannot display
